html: Who hath taken this counsel against Tyre. Isaiah answers his own question: The Lord, who made this plan against Tyre, hath taken this counsel. The Hebrew word ya'ats, translated as both "counsel" (23:8) and "purposed" (23:9), speaks both of the plans made and of the determination to follow through. Elsewhere in Isaiah the Lord plans the destruction of Babylon (14:24, 27) and Egypt (19:12).
